hypothesis_content.title: BTC Implied Volatility Compression Before Major ETF Flow Announcements
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 7-day realized volatility drops below 40% while its 30-day implied volatility remains above 55%, creating a volatility risk premium (VRP) spread >15%, and this occurs during NEUTRAL/BULL regimes, a long volatility position (via BTC options or volatility tokens) entered 24-48 hours before expected major ETF inflow/outflow announcements will generate positive alpha.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETF flow announcements have become consistent volatility catalysts. When volatility is suppressed but options market remains nervous (high VRP), the setup suggests trapped volatility that often releases around these scheduled events. The asymmetry favors long vol as negative flow surprises cause larger moves than positive ones.
entry_conditions: Timing: Within 48 hours before scheduled major ETF flow data release (typically Tuesday/Thursday 4 PM ET)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 30D IV increases by 8 percentage points OR VRP spread narrows to <5%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 7D realized volatility spikes above 50% before announcement (indicating early move)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: VRP >15% setups occurring before ETF announcements fail to produce IV expansion >3 percentage points in 70% of instances over next 3 months.
